descriptionHtml:
A little camera tweak that lets you enjoy your character\'s bum up close.

===Installation======================================
1. Open up your Skyrim.ini file in Notepad (look in Documents > My Games > Skyrim folder)
2. Choose your option below, copy the according lines and paste them in the file:
a) Standard option (camera more centered, nicer view):

[Camera]
fOverShoulderCombatAddY=0.0000
fOverShoulderCombatPosZ=-40.0000
fOverShoulderCombatPosX=30.0000
fOverShoulderPosZ=-40.0000
fOverShoulderPosX=30.0000

b) Better sneaking option (camera more to the side; hand doesn\'t bother the crosshair)

[Camera]
fOverShoulderCombatAddY=0.0000
fOverShoulderCombatPosZ=-40.0000
fOverShoulderCombatPosX=40.0000
fOverShoulderPosZ=-40.0000
fOverShoulderPosX=40.0000

3. Save the changes and close Notepad.
4. Start the game and change the view, as well as draw and holster your weapon for the changes to kick in fully.

*In case you have any of these exact lines already present in the file, replace them with the ones from this description.

===Marksman accuracy==============================
If you usually play in 3rd person (including combat), try adding these lines to Skyrim.ini for better arrow accuracy:

[Combat]
f1PArrowTiltUpAngle=-0.8
f3PArrowTiltUpAngle=0.1

Note: you may need to fiddle with the values here; especially if you use any sort of archery tweak. Keep the values somewhere between -1 and 1, though.
This is only useful if you combat in 3rd person! Your arrows will go off the crosshair while in 1st person view.

===Suggested / used mods==========================
Body replacer of choice (CBBE v3 in my case)
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=2666

Victorias High Heel walk Animation
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=13272

Remodeled Armor CBBEv3
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=13004

===Changelog======================================
v0.3 - improved description; no other changes
v0.2 - added a more offset version for better sneaking
v0.1 - initial release

===Advice=========================================
1. Always keep a safe copy of the game files you edit; especially if you\'ve changed them to your preferences and they work nicely.
2. In case something goes wrong with the values and you forget the defaults - simply delete the edited lines. Skyrim will reset the changes and use default setup.
